toc_entry.title: A Boy And His Airline
toc_entry.description: He walks through airports dressed like Elvis. He paints his planes to look like killer whales. He’s Southwest’s Herb Kelleher, and because of him Texas’ psychic landscape will never be the same.

toc_entry.title: Abortion Street
toc_entry.description: Sixteen years after Roe v. Wade, all the bitterness and horror of the abortion fight can be found at a single site in Dallas.

toc_entry.title: Eat Sweet
toc_entry.description: Peanut patties are red, raspas are blue, sugar is sweet, and so are pralines, pecan pie, kolaches, and seven other great Texas desserts.

toc_entry.title: Poisoned By Their Own Home
toc_entry.description: When the St. Johns returned to their house after having it sprayed for bugs, they discovered why those friendly pest-control people are called exterminators.

toc_entry.title: Side By Side
toc_entry.description: Among the harsh mountains of Chihuahua, Mennonite immigrants and Tarahumara Indians maintain their ancient ways.

toc_entry.title: Don't Call Him Junior
toc_entry.description: President Bush’s oldest son wants to be governor of Texas. He says he’s not following in his father’s footsteps, but his name, his career, and his ideas about politics seem an awful lot like Dad’s.

toc_entry.title: Beyond the Blues
toc_entry.description: The unlikely twosome of eccentric rocker Doug Sahm and blues champion Clifford antone has rescued from obscurity a distinctively rhythmic, indisputably raunchy regional sound.

toc_entry.title: A Developing Art
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: The current show at Houston’s Museum of Fine arts brings 150 years of photography into sharp focus.

toc_entry.title: Living With the Bomb
toc_entry.subtitle: Lifestyles
toc_entry.description: As a teenager, I dreamed of the ultimate hot rod. Then I woke up to find I owned the ugliest car in the world.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: The Comanches in the present; the skinheads in Dallas; the mess in Texas; the crisis in the prisons.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Windsurfers add sparkle to Corpus Christi Bay; the Johnson family says a poignant farewell to one of its own; the golden arches attain alpine heights—but come crashing down in Houston.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: The aggies' vet school is going to the dogs; picture-perfect rivalry in the governor's race; Lloyd Bentsen wants more money for Texas; New York takeover toughs establish an outpost in Houston.
